name: White-bellied Go-away-bird
description: It has an overall grayish coloration with a sharply defined white underbelly. The long tail is gray-black with a wide white band in the middle. A white wing patch is noticeable in flight. Males have a gray beak, females a pea-green one.
spread_note: From Ethiopia and Somalia to Tanzania
proportions: Body length 25 cm, tail length 24.5 cm, wing length 22.5 cm, weight 224–275 g
reproduction: The female lays 2–3 eggs, incubation lasts 27–28 days.
attractions: Like all turacos, it is a social bird living in permanent pairs. Both parents build a messy nest in tree canopies and care for the chicks together.
breeding: We’ve kept them since 2005, with the first successful breeding in 2006.
